required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of ALMB-0168 in Patients With Osteosarcoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II, Multi-center, Single-Arm, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of ALMB-0168 in Patients With Osteosarcoma

collaborator.agency: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase I / II, multi-center, single-arm, open-label study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of ALMB-0168 in patients with osteosarcoma whose prior standard treatment have failed.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a phase I / II, multi-centre, single-arm, open-label study with two parts, a dose-escalation phase (Part I) and a dose-expansion phase (part II). In part I, patients with osteosarcoma whose prior standard treatment have failed will be assigned to receive sequentially higher doses of ALMB-0168 intravenously. The dose-escalation initially will follow an accelerated titration design for the first two dosing groups, then follow a classic 3+3 design. The maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) of ALMB-0168 will be determined in part I. In Part II, 1-3 expansion cohorts will begin to further assess the safety profile and explore efficacy, and each cohort will enroll up to 60 patients with high-grade osteosarcoma in each cohort. All patients will receive multiple administration of ALMB-0168 until either the disease progresses or intolerable toxicity occurs.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 28 days after the last dose in each part study.
primary_outcome.description: Defined by the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events version 5.0 (CTCAE V5.0). Incidence of adverse events will be assessed in both PART I and PART II.
DLTs were assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v.5.0 during the first cycle

primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 6 month after the first dose of the last patient in PART II
primary_outcome.description: 6m-PFSR is defined as the percentage of patients who will be alive and without PD at 6 months from the randomization date. 6m-PFSR will be assessed only in PART II.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 4 weeks after the last dose of the last patient
secondary_outcome.description: Measure the maximum (peak) plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum concentration (Tmax) of ALMB-0168
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 4 weeks after the last dose of the last patient
secondary_outcome.description: Measure the time to reach maximum (peak) plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 4 weeks after the last dose of the last patient
secondary_outcome.description: Measure the minimum (trough) plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: The area under the curve (AUC) of ALMB-0168
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 4 weeks after the last dose of the last patient
secondary_outcome.description: Measure the area under the curve

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 4 weeks after the last dose of the last patient
secondary_outcome.description: calculate the half-life of ALMB-0168

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 4 weeks after the last dose of the last patient
secondary_outcome.description: Measure apparent total clearance(s) from plasma after administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: ORR will be assessed by Blinded Independent Review Committee (IRC) per RECIST Version 1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: DCR will be determined by Response evaluation criteria in solid tumours v1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: DOR was defined as the time from first documented evidence of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) until progressive disease (PD) or death.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from randomization to the first documented PD or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: TTR was defined as the time to a confirmed CR (disappearance of all target lesions) or PR (At least a 30 percent decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions) per RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from randomization to death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 year
secondary_outcome.description: Including pathological fractures, spinal cord compression, hypercalcemia caused by malignant tumors, radiotherapy or surgery for bone lesions for symptom relief

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in alkaline phosphatase (ALP) and lactate dehydrogenase (LDH)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 year
secondary_outcome.description: pre- and post-treatment ALP and LDH changes in blood samples

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Bone Mineral Density (BMD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 year
secondary_outcome.description: Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA) to determine the bone mineral density of the subjects' lumbar spine, hip bone and femoral neck.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose of morphine compared with baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 year
secondary_outcome.description: pre- and post-treatment dose changes of morphine

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of morphine compared with baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 year
secondary_outcome.description: pre- and post-treatment frequency changes of morphine

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of numeric pain scale (NRS) scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 year
secondary_outcome.description: pre- and post-treatment changes of NRS scores (min~max: 0~10; higher scores means a worse outcome)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of quality of life scale (EQ-5D) scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 year
secondary_outcome.description: pre- and post-treatment changes of EQ-5D scores (min~max: 0~100; higher scores means a better outcome)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 4 weeks after the last dose of the last patient
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients with ADA

arm_group.description: Dose Escalation Cohort ：The accelerated titration and traditional "3+3" design will be used in the dose-escalation phase. Seven dose cohorts will be evaluated. ALMB-0168 will be administered intravenously once every 3 weeks until either the disease progresses or intolerable toxicity occurs. Dose Expansion Cohort: Based on the results of Part I, 1-3 dose expansion cohorts will be started to further evaluate the safety and efficacy of ALMB-0168.

intervention.description: ALMB-0168 will be administered intravenously until either the disease progresses or intolerable toxicity occurs.

overall_official.affiliation: the first affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-sen Unibersity
